articles.headline: Parts Didn’t Click Together for Boeing Jet
articles.snippet: Plug and play — a popular concept that allows buyers of computers and electronic games to avoid frustrating assembly — is proving hard to pull off for Boeing.
articles.abstract: Plug and play — a popular concept that allows buyers of computers and electronic games to avoid frustrating assembly — is proving hard to pull off for Boeing.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  Plug and play  a concept that allows buyers of computers and electronic games to avoid frustrating assembly  is proving difficult for Boeing, which staked its 787 Dreamliner on a far-flung network of suppliers that would send what amounts to snap-on components to a plant for final assembly.
articles.byline: By Jeff Bailey and Nicola Clark

articles.headline: Bernanke Is Said to Support Stimulus
articles.snippet: The Fed chairman has said that he would back tax cuts or spending measures, so long as they are temporary.
articles.abstract: The Fed chairman has said that he would back tax cuts or spending measures, so long as they are temporary.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Ben S. Bernanke, chairman of the Federal Reserve, has told lawmakers that he can support tax cuts or spending measures to stimulate the economy, even if they increase the budget deficit, provided the measures are quick and temporary.
articles.byline: By Edmund L. Andrews and David M. Herszenhorn

articles.headline: New Questions on Treating Cholesterol
articles.snippet: Following results of recent clinical trials on popular cholesterol drugs, cardiologists are questioning whether a patient’s cholesterol should be all that matters.
articles.abstract: Following results of recent clinical trials on popular cholesterol drugs, cardiologists are questioning whether a patient’s cholesterol should be all that matters.
articles.lead_paragraph: For decades, the theory that lowering cholesterol is always beneficial has been a core principle of cardiology. It has been accepted by doctors and used by drug makers to win quick approval for new medicines to reduce cholesterol.

articles.headline: In the Math of Mergers, Airlines Fail
articles.snippet: Another lesson in two may not be greater than one.
articles.abstract: Another lesson in two may not be greater than one.
articles.lead_paragraph: Airline stocks rallied last week on news that Delta Air Lines was mulling a takeover of either United Airlines or Northwest Airlines, suggesting that many investors think airline mergers are a brilliant idea.

articles.headline: Gizmos, Gadgets and Steve Jobs, Too
articles.snippet: Apple holds its annual Macworld Expo and it’s chock-full of new high-tech goodies to be tried out.
articles.abstract: Apple holds its annual Macworld Expo and it’s chock-full of new high-tech goodies to be tried out.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s a rock concert! It’s a pep rally! It’s a news conference!

articles.headline: When 3rd Place on the Rich List Just Isn’t Enough
articles.snippet: Casino mogul Sheldon G. Adelson may well be the richest American that most people have never heard of.
articles.abstract: Casino mogul Sheldon G. Adelson may well be the richest American that most people have never heard of.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS  Sheldon G. Adelson, the casino mogul, has seen his personal net worth plummet by more than $15 billion in recent months as Wall Street investors have grown more bearish about the casino companies that are pushing aggressively into Asia.

articles.headline: Even at Home, Backers Worry About Giuliani
articles.snippet: As Rudolph W. Giuliani plummets in some polls, his rivals are encroaching on his own backyard.
articles.abstract: As Rudolph W. Giuliani plummets in some polls, his rivals are encroaching on his own backyard.
articles.lead_paragraph: For months, the Republican establishment in New York and New Jersey marched nearly in lock step behind Rudolph W. Giuliani, the former hometown mayor they were confident would become their party’s nominee for president.

articles.headline: Education Push Yields Little for India’s Poor
articles.snippet: India’s schools have sunk to spectacularly low levels.
articles.abstract: India’s schools have sunk to spectacularly low levels.

articles.headline: McCain Parries a Reprise of 2000 Smear Tactics
articles.snippet: John McCain is deploying a South Carolina Truth Squad to intercept attacks.
articles.abstract: John McCain is deploying a South Carolina Truth Squad to intercept attacks.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Volunteers making telephone calls for Senator John McCain in South Carolina last weekend noticed something odd: Four people contacted said in remarkably similar language that they opposed Mr. McCain for president because of his 1980 divorce from his first wife, Carol, who raised the couple’s three children while Mr. McCain was a prisoner of war in Vietnam.
